content: That's an interesting thought! However, it's important to note that while regeneration is a remarkable ability, it is still limited in what it can repair or regrow. The axolotl's ability to regenerate its limbs is due to the presence of a large number of stem cells that are able to differentiate into specialized cells needed to rebuild the missing organs or tissues. In the case of the platypus, the venomous spurs are specialized structures that are part of the musculoskeletal system, and would need to be able to regenerate not just the muscles, but also the functional components that produce and store the venom. It's unclear if that level of regeneration would be possible, but it's certainly an interesting idea to think about!
